video.title: Code your own YouTube app: YouTube API + HTML + CSS + JavaScript (full tutorial)
video.description:
Create a dynamic YouTube playlist app using HTML, CSS, Javascript and jQuery.

🔗The Completed App - https://codepen.io/Middi/pen/QQrOdB

🔗 Thumbnail image - https://i.ytimg.com/vi/qxWrnhZEuRU/mqdefault.jpg
🔗YouTube Logo - https://github.com/Middi/youtube-api/blob/master/images/logo.png

🎥Check out Richard's YouTube channel - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCimIdsDPn0mE03Cb7C6aR8Q

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

topLevelComment.author: Network Freddy
topLevelComment.text: If you wanted the videos to always be updating how would you do that? I'm assuming API calls to some database where you hold your videos?

replies.author: Sarah Monks
replies.text: Whenever the playlist on youtube is updated your website should automatically update with the new videos that were added (after a page refresh). You might have to set a high value for maxResults so that it gets all the videos. For example if your playlist has 20 videos then you might wanna set the maxResults to say 50 videos so that if any new videos are added to the playlist on youtube then the API will return them too.

replies.author: Yazaar
replies.text:
No. It does not, the API does not have your personal cridentials which makes it impossible to send a comment.

It is probably possible because they do have other authentication options which includes your personal information, this is more complicated tho.

topLevelComment.author: Thomas
topLevelComment.text: I'm trying to use pure JavaScript without jQuery. So, I'm trying to use fetch and promise. But how should I pass the option to the fetch request?

replies.author: Yazaar
replies.text:
Hi, no clue if you got it working because it was 4 months ago :P

What you have to do is this:
You have the dictionary (options) and url as he had in the video. Start with the url and pass it the options this way:

{base-url}/?key=your_key&part=snippet&id=playlist_id

Remember to use all of the keys and values in the url.

https://www.googleapis.com/youtube/v3/playlists/?key=your_key&part=snippet&id=playlist_id

For more information, look up ”url query parameters”
